level.text: The Director shall monitor and verify the abatement of all infractions.

The requirements of this section shall apply to respondents who have admitted an infraction, admitted an infraction with explanation, or were found to have committed an infraction in a decision of an ALJ.

A respondent subject to this section shall be required to certify that each infraction listed on the NOI has been abated, subject to penalties for false statements under ยง404 of the D.C. Theft and White Collar Crimes Act of 1982, D.C. Code ยง22-2405 (2001).
The Director may request a respondent subject to this section to complete and submit to the Director a Notice of Verification certifying that an infraction has been abated.
A Notice of Verification certifying abatement of an infraction shall include the following:
A list of all infractions cited;
The name of the person in violation;
The respondent’s license or permit number;
A complete description of the actions taken to abate the infraction;
Any other information that the Director may require.
The Director may, at any time, request that a respondent provide additional information pertaining to the verification of an abated infraction.
The Director shall issue an additional NOI after reinspection, if the Director determines that the cited infraction continues to exist.
A respondent’s failure to certify that an infraction has been abated as required in the decision of the ALJ may be referred to the Office of Compliance for appropriate action.
